def_en: A ghost is the spirit of a dead person that someone believes they can see or feel.

def_cn: （尤指对可怕事物的）记忆，回忆
def_en: The ghost of something, especially of something bad that has happened, is the memory of it.
If there is a ghost of something, that thing is so faint or weak that it hardly exists.
If a book or other piece of writing is ghosted, it is written by a writer for another person, for example a politician or sportsman, who then publishes it as his or her own work.

def_cn: 没有一点（成功的）可能；机会渺茫
def_en: If someone does not stand or does not have a ghost of a chance of doing something, they have very little chance of succeeding in it.

def_cn: （人）放弃，撂挑子；（机器）报废，不再运转
def_en: If someone gives up the ghost, they stop trying to do something because they no longer believe they can do it successfully. If a machine gives up the ghost, it stops working.
